resources.string: The objective of this app is to allow you to quickly and conveniently log your mood at any time of the day. It will allow you to keep track of your mood profile over time and discover any trends and patterns that can be a first step toward making any improvements in everyday life
mood will provide some tips on how to get started with its features, but first…
Please enter a valid name (up to 15 alphabetical characters only)

Hi %s! This is a view of your moods over time. You can choose the time period over which to show moods (above chart), and the visualisation method (below chart). To add your first mood, press the (+) button

The View tab is where statistics will be shown for different moods and activities over the specified time range, according to your logged mood entries. The top pane allows you to view the locations and activities related to a given mood, and the bottom pane will show the moods related to a given activity
No mood entries found for this time range and mood

The Evaluate tab will show an evaluation of your logged mood entries, and attempt to give some advice based on positive and negative trends that it finds. This tab serves as a way to automatically evaluate your mood entries, so that you don\'t have to
What have you been up to recently?

This is where you can log a mood entry. Logging mood entries allows the app to keep track of your moods over time and visualise them, among other things. To add a mood log, select a mood type at the top and at least one activity that you had been involved in recently. \n\nMultiple activities can be selected, and you can also add your own by pressing the \'Add…\' button. To finalise the mood entry, press the finish button in the bottom right. Adding a mood entry will also store the location linked to the mood, so you may be asked to allow for this
Select a mood and at least one activity
This screen allows you to create a new activity type. Select an icon to associate with the activity, give it a name and finish by pressing the finish button in the bottom right
Select an icon and enter a valid name for the new activity
Activity name is already in use

In settings, you can set reminders to notify you at a specific time each day to log your mood entry. You can also export your mood entries to a spreadsheet for use outside of the app, and further customisation options are available by pressing \'Customise\'
On this screen, you can change the name that the app will refer to you as, and set a new visual theme for the app. Give it a shot!
Please enter a valid name (up to 15 alphabetical characters only)
The team for this app consisted of a solo developer, Neil Browning. The app was created in Android Studio using Java as part of university coursework.
Thanks to Icons8 for the free icons: https://icons8.com \n\nThanks to the MPAndroidChart project created by Philipp Jahoda for its charting capabilities: https://github.com/PhilJay/MPAndroidChart
